pullRequest.title: [BEAM-9703] Fix user distribution metric test by not validating namespace.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Previous validation was too strong.

Namespace differs by testing environments (runners). Use contain substring instead in this PR.
min value is too restrictive for streaming case (where the metrics may get reported as best effort)

Alternative way would be to completely disable this test for streaming (and create a dedicated one).

Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 Update CHANGES.md with noteworthy changes.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.

commit.message: Fix user distribution metric test by using less restricting value.

nodes.bodyText: why would min value be >= 0 but the other values be exact?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -172,10 +172,13 @@ def process(self, element):
     # Verify user distribution counter.
     metric_results = res.metrics().query()
     matcher = MetricResultMatcher(
-        namespace='apache_beam.metrics.metric_test.SomeDoFn',
+        step='ApplyPardo',
+        namespace=hc.contains_string('SomeDoFn'),
         name='element_dist',
         committed=DistributionMatcher(
-            sum_value=10, count_value=4, min_value=1, max_value=4))
+            sum_value=10, count_value=4,

nodes.bodyText:
Why is min different then the others?
I would expect that the same reason this needs to be >= 0 would be the same reason as the others.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -172,10 +172,14 @@ def process(self, element):
     # Verify user distribution counter.
     metric_results = res.metrics().query()
     matcher = MetricResultMatcher(
-        namespace='apache_beam.metrics.metric_test.SomeDoFn',
+        step='ApplyPardo',
+        namespace=hc.contains_string('SomeDoFn'),
         name='element_dist',
         committed=DistributionMatcher(
-            sum_value=10, count_value=4, min_value=1, max_value=4))
+            sum_value=hc.greater_than(0),
+            count_value=hc.greater_than(0),
+            min_value=hc.greater_than_or_equal_to(0),
